result.execSummary:
The defendant David P Love was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Dominique L.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Count 2 - Guilty
Count 1 - Guilty
PRELIMINARY
DRAFT NO. 1
Exhibits S4-7 inventoried and placed in Br 1 Exhibit Room on 10/29/15. vm

Minutes:  Day 2.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Same appearances as before.  Suppression motion commences.  Testimony taken from Sgt. Daniel Cooper.  No further evidence.  Arguments heard on deft's suppression motion.  Deft's suppression motion is denied.  Jury reconvenes @ 9:56am.  Jury sworn.  Preliminary instructions given to the jury.  Opening statements.  Testimony commences - Dominique L., Sgt. Daniel Cooper, P.O. Benjamin Antaramian, Det. Deates, & Meagan Wargolet (Forensic Chemist).  Jurors released for lunch @ 12:08pm; instructed to return @ 1:15pm.   Jurors reconvene @ 1:21pm.  Testimony resumes - P.O. Bisciglia.  State rests @ 1:34pm.  Jurors excused.  Deft wishes to testify; colliquey conducted w/deft.  Jurors reconvene @ 1:44pm.  Defense case commences.  Testimony taken from deft.  Defense rests @ 2:10pm.  Jurors excused from courtroom.  Defense objects to State's rebuttal witness.  Arguments heard.  Court will allow the rebuttal witness.  Jurors reconvene @ 2:36pm.  Rebuttal witnesses - Douglas L. & Michael L.  Rebuttal rests @ 2:43pm.  Jurors excused.  Jury instruction conference held.  Jurors reconvene.  Final instructions given to the jury.  Closing arguments.  Alternate juror - Susette C.  Jurors commence deliberations @ 3:48pm.  Verdict reached @ 3:58pm.  Deft found guilty on both counts.  Jury polled.  Jurors released for the day @ 4:12pm.  State moves for judgment.  No objection by the defense.  Deft adjudged guilty on both counts.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 18mos.  See conditions.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  NOTE - exhibits #1 (THC) & #2 (knife) returned to Sgt. Cooper.
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty James Fields-Bowers.  State failed to disclosure a witness re: chain of custody.  Defense requests the witness be excluded.  Discussion held.  Defense will be allowed a recess until tomorrow due to the last filing of this witness.  Defense suppression motion will be conducted tomorrow prior to commencement of trial.  Voir dire commences today @ 10:27am.  Jury selected @ 11:55am.  Unselected jurors released for the day @ 11:56am.  Selected jurors released @ 12:02pm; instructed to return @ 9:15am.
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty James Fields-Bowers.  JS adjourned to 10/12/15 @ 9am due to another case going to trial.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Fields-Bowers.  The alleged drugs have not been tested today.  State reports the drugs were sent to the crime lab for testing after the FPT on 8/13/15.  Suppression motion filed today by defense.  Mutual request for an adjournment.  Parties admonished about the lack of preparedness for today's trial.  JS/suppression mtn adj to 9/21/15 @ 9am.
